text: one of my favorite ways to eat
cauliflower is roasted
have you ever roasted cauliflower it's
so fantastic you might want to try it
the way that I'm making it today which
is roasted with red onion and then
tossed with pasta sprinkled with a
little bit of olive oil a breadcrumbs I
think you're gonna really love it have
you ever been preheating to 475 and cut
up one head of cauliflower into florets
I like to leave them in relatively large
florets because I say cook they shrink a
little bit and then when you toss them
with the pasta they'll break apart just
a little bit to transfer them to a
rimmed baking sheet and on my baking
sheet I also have one small red onion
that I've cut into wedges
you'll also need five cloves of garlic
take a whole head of garlic and press it
onto your cutting board under the palm
of your hand it should fall right apart
these cloves are actually kind of small
so though the recipe calls for five I
might use like six crush them to peel
them it's the easiest way if they're
kind of small you can leave them whole
if they're large you can cut them in
half and then just throw them onto the
baking sheet with your cauliflower these
will soften and caramelize a little bit
in the oven as well drizzle with two
tablespoons of olive oil and season with
some salt and pepper give it a toss get
them into your 475 degree oven and cook
them until they're caramelized and
softened it takes about 20 minutes
you're gonna want to stir them once or
twice during the time for serving have
some fresh breadcrumbs I just pull some
white bread till it was crumbs and then
tossed it with some olive oil and a
little bit of salt to make some yummy
bread crumbs to sprinkle on top top up a
little bit of fresh parsley about a
quarter of a cup
I have 12 ounces of cavatappi then I'm
cooking in here cavatappi is a fun
shaped pasta a little bit like a fusilli
but a little bit different maybe a
little fancier but you can certainly
substitute facility if you have it give
it a drain hold the bed job you can put
those into the pasta pot I love how
caramelized the cauliflower got it's
nice and golden brown without being
burnt and the onions have really
softened and intensified in color it's
so beautiful
add your pasta quarter cup of grated
Parmesan cheese or more your parmesan
addict like I am a little bit of pasta
water you can add more if it's needed
and then give it a toss stirring your
parsley give it a stir and then serve it
up make sure you use a nice big spoon to
serve so that you can make sure to get
all of the goodness
sometimes the best part sink to the
bottom of the pot I want to make sure
you get them give it a sprinkle of those
crunchy bread crumbs give it a taste and
I think you'll agree it's a great way to
welcome fall
